revised_title: Hydrogen Bonding and Transport in Disordered Silicon: Muon Implantation Modeling
tldr: This article explores the physics and chemistry of hydrogen in materials, focusing on bonding and transport in disordered silicon. The authors use muon implantation modeling to study trap-dominated diffusion and the effects of carriers on hydrogen diffusion. They also discuss the potential role of muon studies in understanding high-energy states and the impact of hydrogen bonding on silicon properties.
